alert.note: Alert for Mayes (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 30 at 2:21AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Mayes County through 245 AM CDT... At 221 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Chouteau, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Pryor... Pryor Creek... Chouteau... Locust Grove... Salina... Langley... Spavinaw... Disney... Hoot Owl... Rose... Spavinaw State Park... Sportsmen Acres Community... Strang... Mazie... Snowdale State Park... Disney Little Blue State Park... Murphy... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for northeastern and east central Oklahoma.
